section.title: Evaluate 3D data with a bead calibration sample

task.title: Record a bead calibration data file

taskprerequisites.para: We assume that you have an appropriate cylindrical lens in detection path and are using an objective piezo (e.g. PIfoc, Physik Instrumente). The sample should be a thinly coated Tetraspeck bead sample. Beads should be preferred because of the superior brightness and - in case of tetraspec beads - of the sub-resoulution size. You should know the size of the input pixels.
Make sure you have rapidSTORM 2.20 or later installed.

procedure.step: place Tetraspeck surface on microscope

Set the piezo to a continuous pattern. In this example we use the following settings:
functiontriangular low position45 &mgr;m high position55 &mgr;m frequence0.02 Hz
Set camera exposure time (0.02 s)
Compute and remember piezo movement per frame ((55 &mgr;m - 45 &mgr;m) * 2 * 0.02 Hz * 0.02 s/fr = 8 nm/fr). This will later be needed as an evaluation input.
focus on Tetraspeck
start piezo
record data

task.title: Produce calibration curve
task.taskprerequisites: We assume that you have recordad a bead calibration data file and have some plotting software, e.g. gnuplot, Origin or Matlab, at your disposal.

procedure.step: Start rapidSTORM 2
Set User level to Medium or higher
Set Input file to calibration data file (in this example: foo.tif)
Check Ignore libtiff warnings
Set Size of input pixel to pre-calibrated values (e.g. 142 and 125 nm in X/Y, respectively)
Set Amplitude discarding threshold to a high value (5000 ADC) in order to filter noise
Set Fit window radius to a value considerably higher than the best-focused PSF FWHM in order to include the PSF tails, and remember the input. (1100 nm)
Set maximum number of iteration steps for spot fitting to 100 (optinal)
Check boxes PSF width is free fit parameter and Store PSF covariance matrix

Go to the output option and set
Value to assign to to posz Expression to assign from to 8 nm/fr * frame Click Add expression Set the new Value to assign to to psffwhmx and psffwhmx - 25 nm
This value is a wild guess. It should denote how much wider a fairly large object like a Tetraspec looks than a fluorophore. Click Add expression Set the new Value to assign to to psffwhmy and psffwhmy - 25 nm Click Add expression Choose new output to
Go to the output and set Number of B spline breakpoints to 10
Click Run

The generated calibration curves are stored in foo-sigma-table.txt. Plot the PSF standard deviation (columns 2 and 3) against the Z position (column 1) (a description what you find in each column is given in the header of foo-sigma-table.txt)

Check that the calibration curves have no local maxima
If local maxima exist, narrow the range of usable Z data in the second Expression to assign from field in the output (e.g. to posz > 2000 nm && posz < 6000 nm ) and go back to Otherwise continue with

Plot the PSF widths in the localization file foo.txt (columns 6 and 7) against the Z truth (column 3) and check for outlier points
If outliers are present, raise Minimum localization strength and go back to Otherwise continue with
You are done with the generation of the calibration file. Close the rapidSTORM2 job.

task.title: Make 3D super-resolved image colour-coded by Z
task.taskprerequisites: We assume that you have a correct bead calibration data file file for your setup.

procedure.step: (Re-)Start rapidSTORM
Set 3D PSF model to Interpolated 3D
Set Z calibration file to the file name of the calibration curve file.
Set Amplitude discarding threshold to a similar value as in 2D (e.g. 1000)
Set Fit window radius to the same value you used for producing the calibration curve (1100 nm)

Go to the Image Display output and
Set Colour palette for display to Vary hue with sample coordinate (optional) Set Coordinate to vary hue with to position in sample space z(optional)
Run evaluation and wait for job to finish

task.title: Make 3D super-resolved Z stack
task.taskprerequisites: We assume that you have a correct calibration curve file for your setup.

procedure.step: (Re-)Start rapidSTORM
Set user level to Medium
Set 3D PSF model to Interpolated 3D
Set Z calibration file to the file name of the calibration curve file.
Set Amplitude discarding threshold to a similar value as in 2D (e.g. 1000)
Set Fit window radius to the same value you used for producing the calibration curve (1100 nm)

Go to the Image Display output and
Set Resolution in X direction to 20 nm Set Resolution in Y direction to 20 nm Set Resolution in Z direction to 50 nm Check Make 3D image Change extension of Save image to to .tif
Run evaluation and wait for job to finish
